column4: why is update manager giving me warnings about "untrusted sources" ??  and how do i fix this issue??  10.10 amd/64
: you can install that app through the terminal
: you can install that app through the terminal . it gives untrusted if it's not in the ubuntu software center
then why is it looking outside the software center for upgrades?
: Every package has dependencies if anyone of them is untrusted it'll show u that msg
ok, had NEVER seen this warning before.... so, thought i should inquire..... Thank You!
: You are welcome .
i think something is farkled on my system.... synaptic is giving me warning about untrusted upgrades even for things i already have installed... FROM ubuntu repositories.
it is asking for 10.04.1 lts..  cd.... even tho i am at 10.10 .....is this normal?
: run sudo "apt-get update" from the terminal and then "apt-get upgrade"  without quotes
yepper, did that.... why does it want 10
: wat are u trying to doing ?
i simply wanted to apply the current upgrades to 10.10
: ayou have 10.04 Lts currently installed ?
no, i am at 10.10
i upgraded some time ago from 10.04.2 .... to 10.10
: you used the cmd line and still it's asking for the 10.04 lts cd  ?
that is correct....
: i  guess did u installed the updates correctly ? lik all of them or it was a partial upgrade  ?
total upgrade via locally burned cd.... ALL md5 hashes matched.... the upgrade reported success at the end.... total upgrade... No interruptions.... amd/64
: i guess start logout start in safe mode and use the previous command some of the packages might be interfering with each other and file a bug or report it
ok, i will give that a try.... Thanks Again for your help!    laters.
